description: ERECTION OF A PART SINGLE PART TWO STOREY REAR EXTENSION. ERECTION OF A REAR ROOF EXTENSION WITH INSTALLATION OF ROOFLIGHTS TO THE FRONT SLOP.E SINGLE STOREY FRONT EXTENSION WITH ALTERATIONS TO FRONT PORCH AND BAY WINDOW.
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: 

Design & Access Statement
Site Location Plan - 01107-P-50
Site Plan - 01107-P-51
Existing & Proposed Block Plans - 01107-P-54
Proposed Floor Plans - 01107-P-255
Proposed Elevations - 01107-P-360
Proposed Elevations - 01107-P-361

Condition : 3 - The facing materials to be used for the development hereby permitted shall be those specified in the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 4 - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development)(England) Order 2015 (or any order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification), no window, door or other opening other than those expressly authorised by this permission shall be constructed in side elevations without planning permission first being obtained from the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 5 - Before the development hereby permitted is first occupied, the proposed windows in the side elevation at first floor level and above shall be glazed with obscured glass and shall be maintained as such thereafter.

Condition : 6 - Access to the flat roof of the development hereby permitted shall be for maintenance or emergency purposes only, and the flat roof shall not be used as a roof garden, terrace, patio or similar amenity area.

Condition : 7 - No demolition or construction work or ancillary activities such as deliveries shall take place before 8am or after 6pm Mondays - Fridays inclusive, before 8am or after 1pm on Saturdays or at any time on Sundays or Bank Holidays.

Condition : 8 - In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:

   i) Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
   ii) Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
   iii) As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.

In this instance:

   i) The applicant/agent was provided with pre-application advice.
   ii) The application was acceptable as submitted and no further assistance was required.
